featured.text: As Deborah shuffled sideways to block the player, her knee went out and she collapsed on the court in burning pain.
A strong desire burns inside Bekoji’s young runners.
Dioxin is an unwanted byproduct that is created when PVC is burned.
The electrical shock burned almost half of his body and melted layers of his skin off.

other.text: Such deep and extensive burns can be fatal.
Some have saved people from drowning or from burning buildings.
The townspeople built a _____ in memory of the brave teacher who sacrificed her life to save her students from a burning bus.

definition.zh_def: 燃燒，發熱或發光的過程，通常伴隨著火焰和煙霧。
definition.en_def: To consume fuel or material with fire, producing heat and light.
definition.example: Be careful not to burn yourself while cooking.
